content:
Updates!

  • Prelude changes: RFC merged. Adding the items to the 2021 prelude, about to be merged: #85687. Migration lint, in progress: #85707
  • Reserved prefixed literals: Some discussion about exact implementation and edge cases.
  • IntoIterator for Arrays: Lint updates: #85682. Other small docs/lint/examples/std changes still open: #84513
  • Rustfix multiple spans support: Will be fixed by rustfix#195
  • --force-warn: Implementation started in #85788
  • Disjoint captures: Nearing completion, see the rfc 2229 project board.
@jam1garner @rylev How is it going with your PRs? Any blockers or any way someone can help?
I'm waiting on an initial review for --force-warns. There are a bunch of open questions on how exactly we want to handle things.
We created #85894 -- can folks log the relevant lints there?
@Aman Arora :point_up:
@rylev we should add the lints from lang
@nikomatsakis I don't believe we added any lints in our discussion as we only promoted previous lints to errors, we did not add any new lints or promote previously allow-by-default lints to warnings
but those previous lints should be part of it right? this is the list of lints that should trigger in 2018 crates to give all the suggestions needed to upgrade to code that's valid in 2021
Ah yes of course. You are correct. I see you've added the two lints already. Thanks!

nikomatsakis said:

We created #85894 -- can folks log the relevant lints there?

We renamed the lint to disjoint_capture_migration in #84730
